title: StaticAPI - Static Content API Generator
short_description: A webapp that allows users to create a static content API endpoint.
description:
A webapp that allows users to use a visual editor *(or file editor)* to create a static endpoint to serve JSON files for their application. 
 ## Why?
Serving static content is a common use case for many applications, such as this portfolio where you want to be able to edit content without having to redeploy the application. This webapp allows you to do just that, by allowing you to create a static content API endpoint that can be used in your applications.

## How?
The webapp allows you to create a static content API endpoint by providing a simple interface to create and edit content. The content is stored in a PostgreSQL database, and the API endpoint is generated using NextJS and Prisma.

title: South Brunswick High School Attendance Webapp
short_description: A webapp that allows club officers to track student attendance with IP and geolocation restrictions
description: Created a NextJS website that allows students to scan a QR code to track their club and event attendance. It also allows club officers to create check in events, view all students who have checked in. They can also restrict login to students located at the school using IP and geolocation. They can also export data to a spreadsheet for easy viewing and logging. Students can view all their attendance for a specific club as well.

title: Circlize Mobile Android App
short_description: Android app that allows users to create or join Circles, post messages, and change their user details.
description: An Android app that allows users to create or join Circles, in which they can then post messages to the stream. Additionally, they can change their username, and profile pictures. Features a login and signup screen as well. Connected to Flask server through a Rest API, which would then connect to the Firebase database to write and read data.

title: Weather Mobile Android App
short_description: Android app that allows users to view the weather according to a Zip Code.
description: Project in mobile application class. Developed an Android weather app that utilized the OpenWeather API to display weather information. Design inspired by the Apple weather app.
